```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```
```{r, x}
indiana <- x %>%  
  clean_names() %>% 
  slice(552, 563) %>%
  select(government_function, whole_dollars) %>%
  filter(whole_dollars > 0) %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = whole_dollars, y = fct_reorder(government_function, whole_dollars))) + 
  geom_col(alpha = 0.5) + 
  labs(title = "Government Departments Earnings in Indiana", 
       subtitle = "The Education department gets the most amount of money annually",
       x = "Money earned",
       y = "Government Job Department") + 
  theme_classic() +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::number_format())
indiana

```
